document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Public Services

8CF5170FE428442A84F8869BBDFC5DA0.description: Discuss the various aspects of fee setting in the law office, including fixed fees, minimum fees, contingent fees, retainers, payment schedules, and billing practice.

435CE94FE4254116BFC30279B3B3916D.description: Discuss what constitutes legal malpractice, and illustrate the discussion with examples of malpractice.

05AC5F81B34444249BE3C4805C853B4A.description: List, discuss, and apply the rules of ethics in the legal profession, with special emphasis on client confidentiality.

5CF669787E7F4458A657FD4FA2D634EC.description: List the advantages of data management and microcomputer skills in a law office.

606B201721A2489AAEF1E5A8E3FCD79F.description: Describe how client files are opened, maintained, and closed.

FA5D3E80D03449D0B76B09B17530CF0D.description: List and discuss techniques for improving the confidence that clients will have in the personnel of the law office.

6CDC7FD70E9A4356B15619BD60CAE9E9.description: Define a variety of terms and concepts related to law-office management and structure.

A4DE9C3E4CF94C6CB2E823CBE605903D.description: Describe alternative methods for resolving ethical dilemmas within the legal environment.

2C219A03A69448AAA68809FC79675E9B.description: Understand the roles and responsibilities that lawyers (including judges) have in our society.

194FB1DB0A3B4AE1B32B22179EF68739.description: Explain how judges, lawyers, and paralegal personnel function in our legal system.

381DA374B2744D249CECB00A8A2BDEFA.description: Define a variety of legal terms and concepts related to professionalism and the unauthorized practice of law.

4D86DCE197F44CE3A3EE494386542D11.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the ethical and professional standards of the legal professions and knowledge of management techniques and procedures.

8962D3EB61514012B8B1B5CB2ABD1D51.description: Create a hypothetical case and describe why you would or would not like to participate as a juror on that case.

B785BFCDA71D4D5CA49E79512859C97E.description: Describe the judge's role, the role of the prosecutor, and that of the defense attorney.

013A913B000E4CFBB0B6059CB73CF9A2.description: Understand the purpose and process of jury voir dire and how it determines the makeup of the jury panel.

5522B93DCC9F4CF594C1E2F8E962BD1B.description: Understand the importance of the jury in relation to fairness and due process.

5E25D951AB4A488C850E2B25F21E3508.description: Describe the role of a jury in a criminal case versus a civil case in state court proceedings.

4D63173AA7A540FA9A01E38724EA5142.description: Discuss the evaluation and use of evidence.

3F0DE6D409394F228E29E97843725B1C.description: Describe how the results of background investigation and analysis can be presented to the attorney

F775155DD6684862A22D5C469EA21A37.description: List the sources of information for conducting background investigations.

A537F2A9E952473DA357A2826752F311.description: Describe the purpose of background investigations and analysis.

49C7C3EC655844DAAC118EF4C31B7B79.description: Describe the techniques for asking questions and list the basic points for good listening.

FC3E75D23F884C729052538EA3CA8F34.description: Describe the purpose and contents of a trial notebook.

F3F63974572F49B1BD2D11126D36F193.description: Describe how evidence and exhibits are organized for trial.

30A2123B58304D9D99FF5E8E62DFAD43.description: Discuss the basic rules of procedure and evidence code.

98284A1776C249F688567B6DC30D9462.description: Explain the basic concept of the Statute of Limitations.

C109A5E178424E6AAA5774F4B06CFB04.description: List and briefly explain six causes of action in civil cases.

8EEBCD7C7A0747D59C93B48A4D1F2676.description: Explain the sequence and basic contents of pleadings.

C5B21042C185413F87CD2E40DFD292C3.description: Describe the typical steps in jury and nonjury civil trials, from pretrial through the appeal.

4F32832A605C4D0E82120C9984A73893.description: Define a variety of terms associated with litigation and trial practice.

54CAB52D58A543EC80EB289D92B6E272.description: Demonstrate a general understanding of all phases of trial practice and procedure, as well as knowledge of and ability to perform litigation techniques and procedures.

6CDBD90E128A427184344978E1E96C1F.description: Identify emerging issues of law related to infringement of intellectual property and discuss how personal access to, and use of, technology makes intellectual property infringement easier.

01B635CE14A045F59AD033289126963F.description: Explain the ways in which creative rights can be compromised, such as plagiarism and "sampling."

3555471AF8BF40B2928ECFF23FEBF779.description: Understand the definition of "intellectual property": the legal concept that certain types of creations—musical, literary, and artistic works; discoveries and inventions; and words, phrases, symbols, and designs—are types of property "owned" by their creators and cannot be copied or used without the permission of the creators.

0539191FBA0D48F1B0A3009583AFE1E3.description: Discuss how social media can be used by governments or individuals to suppress or enhance freedom of expressions.

A869E0B38302454AB0BB3834D9A595AF.description: Demonstrate an appreciation for balancing the First Amendment right to free speech vs. the interest of parents, schools, and the government regulating social media because of concerns about privacy, online bullying, defamation/slander, and harassment.

C059D70F2424443488FB01272558D665.description: Describe the economic barriers to equal public access to technology and legal strategies for overcoming them.

4F16DF79C46B4D759AEFEE946AB37D73.description: Explore emerging issues of law related to personal access to, and use of, technology.

7DF5351BE7784E669AE7DD2539DC96B3.description: Recognize the importance of laws and procedures related to intellectual property.

4FAA19C2F7424973A5C12F77793C8D8C.description: Discuss the nature of the agency relationship, including the duties and liabilities of the principal, the agent, and third parties.

4941D7FF3CCE49A0A49BF8767C803D7E.description: Discuss the rights, duties, and liabilities of the owners, officers, directors, and employees of various types of business organizations.

79FBD649B88B485AB648D870CED59558.description: Compare the major advantages and disadvantages of the various types of business organizations.

89B5FB88D1AE4E048C445B4929E9B4CD.description: Describe the procedures necessary to form, modify, and dissolve various types of business organizations.

14C47CD3460A4EEE945BD0DCF22B1F61.description: Define a variety of terms associated with business organizations.

F7A53C9EF80B490195F049B23EA3487D.description: Understand the fundamental principles of the law of business organizations.

6DD082D311074ED99118C84EB80E1315.description: Explain the basic procedures, claims, and responses in an unlawful detainer case.

22616851F0CE45FDBE33DF772E6F7162.description: Understand the basic rights and responsibilities of both landlords and tenants.

1029C2AB7DF64C7CAF945D6D3AF71628.description: Identify the types of discrimination that renters and home buyers might face.

AE3AB664101A470CA08A67F03CF1E505.description: Create a personal will, following legal guidelines.

15E1C7A81BE34935BAFA91443F65C27C.description: Explain the purposes of wills and codicils.

14523203DAF742C3BCEE3B188FE61C94.description: Explain the general procedures of the probate process.

F1350D90C517488E9128ED87F9422381.description: Compare and contrast a trust and a will, including advantages and disadvantages for each.

75D58389300943C8AA1F3A89468F565B.description: Define a simple Inter Vivos, and a Testamentary trust.

EF3340BA1179456385B1E3B3D74B6CD6.description: Define a variety of terms and concepts associated with wills, trusts, and probate administration.

A59AE5BD6AC643CCA5D52038E4693A6B.description: Compare a variety of real property documents, such as a lease, a promissory note, an option contract, and an agreement for deed or a mortgage, and be able to prepare at least one.

969D6A720A4F43DC8DC9500E96E01834.description: Describe the steps and procedures in a typical real estate closing.

AFF6A7E617EB454380B24DDEBC1AAC4B.description: Explain at least two types of encumbrances that can be placed against real property.

72E132FC7A2044709BA34A1043103B36.description: Explain the most common forms of limitations on real property use, such as covenants, easements, zoning laws, and land-use regulations.

73F30DB0A4A447B0858FF49AD973A0E1.description: Explain how "recording" is accomplished and the importance of recording a deed, mortgage, or other real estate documents.

5A40332E4F6D4713B402C594299D93F8.description: Discuss the purpose of title insurance, a title search, and how the "search" is made.

96CC16FD78604256A79EFA5270E3CDA2.description: Describe the basic requirements of a contract for sale of real property.

262483C13E9A4C0E809797402A2DC1F7.description: Contrast the basic responsibilities of the lawyer and the real estate broker in the conveyance of real property, from the sales or option contract to the recording of the deed.

A54C6874276A48E7BE215C281B0CAF0D.description: Discuss real property concepts, including but not limited to the types of estates that can be conveyed under California law.

4739470383D34AB88C774AF7B4F82646.description: Define a variety of terms associated with real estate transactions.

E160D62710FE4C9CA37E4AF3B4D8E759.description: Distinguish personal property from real property.

F46D9B74312843008D0987D6A8055EF4.description: Demonstrate knowledge of property law and its application to property transactions, estate planning and probate administration, and housing law, including landlord/tenant and fair housing laws.

6F79A77491D543C3BF960F7C41DA904C.description: Prepare a sample of a false advertisement.

604E906B10D24806B804FCA7F90D6189.description: Analyze deceptive business practices, including false advertising, "bait and switch" sales practices, and truth-in-lending disclosure requirements.

6442457E11284571A9230226C47E0F31.description: Interpret contract rules and expectations, including specific performance, breach of contract, remedies for breach of contract, third-party beneficiary, and requirements for modifications.

15D1834C7DE14A0A91D9CED34CCAE128.description: Describe the elements of a contract, including contract terminology.

DF9EECEF3A6342139CC023190D00F1FC.description: Identify ways by which the Internet and social media can be used to inform consumers and address deceptive business practices.

6FC220EBD9584AC3B1D121128AA491D8.description: Identify emerging business practices that may result in consumer fraud or deception.

1F38BD626C4E40F8B1F0ABEB0B250DBE.description: Recognize various types of contracts, such as adhesion, bilateral, unilateral, implied, and express.

34940DE143CA444A8CB53E9E0A9CAB26.description: Recognize the differences between void and voidable contracts.

474F20A8C4F44A10AD13AE3291B180D1.description: Demonstrate a familiarity with fundamental principles of contract law (including the uniform commercial code) and fundamentals of consumer protection law.

A27A013F9F5E422B9542981BC8335263.description: Prepare a chart displaying the process for applying for citizenship, including a display of the average number of immigrants who apply each year and the percentage of successful applicants.

26782FCA88A84DDC941E5058CF9CA2F7.description: Explain the process and basis for political asylum.

13301CBF554D4F17823F5146C1BFACFD.description: Describe the various types of immigration visas.

4A69712B6C2E4EE3A763E5D8ECD7C04A.description: Define a variety of legal terms and concepts related to immigration law.

0025A6D82D7B4ADDABB08C3D6D807BC4.description: Discuss the concept of implicit bias and the impact it has on the criminal and civil justice systems.

8464B54B762F4E0CB1EEF64C438B167F.description: Research court data regarding annual statewide numbers of criminal proceedings and demographics of defendants; discuss disproportionate minority contact.

1C2CFD3E03384E34A69D6E7C617DF95C.description: Discuss each stage in a criminal proceeding, from investigation to disposition (e.g., arrest, prosecution of crimes, and defenses of criminal prosecution) and postconviction procedure.

693F7D9714B942AFBF1A82D1B4244D7A.description: Describe types and elements of crimes against persons and property, overlapping crimes against people and their property, and inchoate crimes.

3B84B32B31D140BCA4A429F0614649DC.description: Discuss and define terms and concepts of criminal law, including the theory of criminal law (Malum in se and Malum prohibitum) and the evolving nature of criminal law (e.g., the legal definition of a viable human being).

69152A045C604D62A05AEC5A17FD21BE.description: Analyze the Fourteenth Amendment, particularly (1) the Due Process Clause and Substantive Due Process, as contrasted with Procedural Due Process; and (2) the Equal Protection Clause.

BDF6C5DE0EF4423DBEC983A68ED4DE61.description: Discuss the United States Constitution, including its philosophical underpinnings and structure.

7073FCA72DD64FBD8A7ADF3672884A7D.description: Demonstrate knowledge of constitutional law, criminal law, immigration law, and related concepts, as well as their application to factual situations.

C83603ED350E478EBEDAF7B07E6525B7.description: Describe defenses to negligence actions, including strict and product liability.

455B574E2BD2427094F7DC3AAF326C2D.description: Describe the tort of negligence and the elements of negligence (e.g., "reasonable person," res ipsa loquitur, proximate cause).

43D88D6973424AB88F9520E0D0CDACFD.description: Define the tort concept of civil wrong and apply the concept to factual situations with persons, property, and defenses of an intentional tort.

72B33792FF1C47DABE9EB585735ED1E6.description: Demonstrate an understanding of tort law and concepts and their application to factual situations.

7DDE008DBF164F8A904BA41FB4420DD6.description: Prepare a legal brief to represent the defendant in the hypothetical case.

E408999DD3D946489CA60283491312DD.description: Create a hypothetical case and identify the applicable statutory, regulatory, and case law.

780E11F33023436D92E79722A90ED32C.description: Contrast case law with statutory law and explain how to interpret statutes using intrinsic and extrinsic sources.

48C6F05D8F1A4C4D8C4825356009ED33.description: Discuss case law, how it is made, its component parts, and how to use cases to resolve a legal problem.

172C4F808B6F47279B86FF074A558584.description: Discuss the purpose of a legal memorandum, brief or points, and authorities to a particular audience (how the memorandum may vary in emphasis and style, depending on the audience).

231849AF37C64B9882CF0CBE4E28F1E3.description: Discuss the term "authority" as it is used in legal writing, and explain the hierarchy of authority and the difference between mandatory and persuasive authority.

836E768B9F5741DCB8D2D8CA709F3144.description: Demonstrate how to analogize or distinguish the facts and law of one case from the facts of a given legal problem.

55EEDF691B2E42A9B6868EDA1AB6179D.description: Demonstrate the ability to locate and update legal authority using computer-assisted legal research tools.

D0D0CAA1808A40D0ADA49C5A7AECF5BD.description: Demonstrate the ability to use a uniform system of citing cases for updating and cross-referencing cases.

540BF55F95304358BBC28E110B6BD46C.description: Demonstrate a working knowledge of the legal research system by writing a short memorandum on a given question of law and explaining the steps taken to find sources and reach conclusions.

A854B5A1250143C5B31DBD9167A88558.description: Explain the difference between legal publications, treatises, and other legal writings.

41FE4323FD0F4776B332F4A81236047B.description: Explain the importance and purpose of legal research.

A0FC392967354D1FA4EA92BF5DF2D568.description: List the basic steps in legal research, including the legal publications most commonly used in the practice of law.

A3157C0DBA2449DB83E59E99101C399D.description: Demonstrate an understanding and ability to utilize legal research and writing.

2F3A51415D4C49709D79D90C125B140F.description: Contrast the fundamental features of civil, criminal, and administrative law.

972D9D1EB10B4AA1BDE9EB99229642B7.description: Present and defend the case for diversity in the legal professions.

CD81BD78A0B3482A9E96481A715F3F74.description: Become familiar with the concept of equal access to justice.

22D9CC1D067E4CECB506AB820B12B903.description: Explain the court system of the State of California, including the different types of state courts and their jurisdictions.

5C25B5B8957A49A78D925AE3A9EE1680.description: Become familiar with educational and experiential requirements needed to establish and maintain successful careers in each practice area.

D97797EF841249278C16D40A153FABF1.description: Identify, by practice area, the types of clients served and related legal needs and issues.

2CE76C0B13A64B8CAC71EFCBD7DE72FD.description: Identify the primary legal practice settings (e.g., private firms, government and public sector entities, corporate counsel, and public interest practice), and explain the nature and scope of each practice area.

6B741884964F408980EAE009ECDFDEC5.description: Describe the different levels of federal courts and their jurisdictions.

50F0E3B1D9394E51B9F0AF87D4D93A98.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the state and federal justice system, the Rule of Law, and the environment/practice settings for legal professionals.

comments: The Legal Practices pathway prepares students with a broad-based foundation of knowledge pertaining to the various types of law and of legal practice and provides a foundation of basic skills necessary at all levels in the legal professions.

1DF51352C123431CA694BFB45DCCFDC9.description: Build a plan describing processes and procedures to follow prior to, during, and after a wildfire event.

6259F2F65E4840758D00086F0FCBE8BB.description: Describe and evaluate the importance of the various types of equipment used to control and/or extinguish wildland fires.

FB9509B2DC4E4885A0F9F610F30D5DFB.description: Recognize factors that influence the start and spread of wildland fires.

859EE5B1A83244F2909FA4FA7EE8019C.description: Evaluate the importance of the fire suppression aviation program.

C1ABA08E00A14F2FA599914C35E0F217.description: Create a state map showing the locations of wildland lookouts, and describe the lookouts' purpose and staffing.

5E171D61DDF84A499663C905EC651D0E.description: Assess the value of the resource management program, including the impact on timber, watershed, wildlife, and recreation.

F80D96E0E48046A5BC5AB97F9F578D26.description: Describe fire prevention and planning procedures to save wildland structures during a forest fire.

86EF32E192D347C98EC5F063D8968092.description: Explain the role of fire personnel in wildland fires, structure fires, auto accidents, medical aid, swift-water rescue, civil disturbances, search and rescue operations, hazardous material spills, train wrecks, floods, and earthquakes.

0D52722FFA6B4426995C2234B42D81C5.description: Describe wildland firefighter safety and survival preparations.

EEB600391702434A8D9CDAA24B577F85.description: Analyze and describe the functions and responsibilities of federal, state, and local wildland services.

19653D7BBF374E5BBEEEB9F5C5D1DC7B.description: Describe the function of emergency vehicles, use of medical and communication equipment, and the necessity of maintaining inventory as required for emergency services practices and procedures.

8CF63C2AF85E469A9BC3CCC60D1D509B.description: Demonstrate the ability to receive and provide patient-care information to other medical providers.

CCE793A2489B4B94BE3863D31955A4F4.description: Communicate with treatment-center staff to arrange reception of victims and to get instructions for further treatment.

57D82FA8C7B94694985A4D39DC9D0672.description: Demonstrate the ability to assess the nature and extent of an illness or injury to establish and prioritize medical response.

3C494AB28AC34715AC365DEBB828B1C8.description: Execute protocols in emergency management response when working with an on-scene accident.

EE3A4692AEE44B41906F5EE80B135575.description: Manage an incident scene as the first responder, using emergency response skills appropriate to training and certification.

AB8B223C775C494A8485AAEFCA87B628.description: Demonstrate administration of a limited number of drugs appropriate to the scope of practice.

2EAD73D240894DCAA4467BA92C19FDC3.description: Follow instructions for immediate care procedure as transmitted by an emergency medical dispatcher during transport.

CBCC610899C645338B69889133521542.description: Perform technical skill and equipment use required for emergency response occupations—for example, airway, oxygen, and ventilation procedures; suction; bleeding control; shock management; cardiac arrest management; immobilization techniques; traction; splinting; transport; defibrillation; and wound management.

22BA5EC84BEC4878B9C1A0532E8AB495.description: Know the common acronyms used in fire and emergency services.

ABF646FDEA5D47E58DDD3B7CF1B7A092.description: Understand and use medical terminology and related knowledge of anatomy, physiology, diseases, diagnoses, pharmacology, therapeutics, and common abbreviations necessary for emergency medical services.

3A6452DFD63D487F93FC58706A4115E8.description: Demonstrate the immediate basic life support and interim medical care for a sick, injured, or compromised person until advanced medical care is provided or transport is initiated.

533DED0577BB4BD2B649A776E105FC80.description: Participate in public education aimed at reducing loss of life and property, through programs and activities on fire prevention and safety as well as other injury-prevention education.

CA4DA592842E4A1C9781BF247FE80231.description: Apply principles of proper body mechanics, including ergonomics, equipment use, and techniques to prevent personal injury.

23892583C86940B5AEBDEE0296C929DE.description: Identify structural characteristics of building construction types as they relate to fire protection and suppression, and recognize the signs and causes of potential building collapse and other hazards.

EE8EA88CC2534C9198F2CB5E8EA112E7.description: Demonstrate the skills necessary to perform fire suppression and basic rescue operations using firefighting techniques and rescue equipment.

DE984263BE084B20A75EB85ACE9E0DA6.description: Demonstrate the operation of fire protection equipment and systems.

FDEE76D2914E4441A077C877215C8C91.description: Explain the fundamentals and scientific principles of fire behavior, combustible materials, extinguishing agents, hazardous and toxic materials, forms of energy, and fire prevention/suppression techniques for all types of fires and conditions.

427AF6C12F914F4C872F7E53B5C4F0C6.description: Describe the skills and knowledge necessary for an entry-level firefighter to safely perform the tasks required of the job.

E7BCE35736B14F1ABFB0EE72492801E8.description: Understand the history, organization, and operation of fire services.

16CC12742CD1403ABB3C9E5F95274064.description: Understand the fundamental mission of fire services occupations and the responsibility to preserve life and property, promote public safety, and reduce fire deaths.

BA8614E08F2746FCB794D697A136588A.description: Research and report on the most common incidents involving hazardous materials.

4C9309D8C814435795780373061B68DE.description: Explain the steps taken, including appropriate personnel and safety measures, for a hazardous-material release.

9B1B2E3090E34FFFAC2D89F6D742D610.description: Describe the type of damage and injury that can occur if hazardous materials are handled improperly.

3EB44B18D44747EB913836C0EA47AEE9.description: Describe the hazardous materials labeling system and identify definitions associated with various hazardous materials.

334A94A5DCAB47188AC8BD33C6DBC7DC.description: Research and define what is considered to be hazardous materials incidents and threats.

3996EF4105CB417482D1968A2977F345.description: Recognize the importance and variety of recovery strategies to support individuals and communities impacted by a catastrophic event.

A40058835093471798E31E19BD24798D.description: Prepare an emergency preparedness and response plan that includes the roles of emergency response personnel for a potential catastrophic event in the community.

9BB4495ABE884FE481061304F5BEB026.description: Review a hazard mitigation plan to reduce death and injury for potential man-made and natural hazards.

F1E6B31E9EF34CE6A2314E3C6A9D6592.description: Analyze the history and outcomes of catastrophic events and the appropriate emergency responses.

25C616D618D849D4A1F132D1B79EF6E1.description: Describe steps for each potential catastrophic event.

7B8745C72E5248ECBB8DFC645B9E9449.description: Understand the roles of federal, state, and local agencies in catastrophic event planning, preparation, response, and recovery.

4357211B74264FE882FD0F087489C9E9.description: Recognize and understand the importance of maintaining psychological health and well-being in emergency response occupations.

C64397B2307B4D7BB6250D158962C824.description: Design and implement a personal plan for achieving and maintaining an acceptable level of nutrition, strength and agility, and a lifetime fitness mindset.

3E889A61F1194CDAB39A1FAE8DDAFDE3.description: Apply the skills and techniques necessary for success in strength and agility testing.

D3083A7CD42E4522B048C64C4F64CEEC.description: Recognize the different physical strength and agility assessments required for entrance into emergency response employment.

6F91DD49C355403B814344F1174FE3B6.description: Understand that physical fitness and proper nutrition are needed to perform the duties of emergency response personnel.

09E079B898E94E05AA4F685A01C848F7.description: Develop the level of nutrition, fitness, strength, agility, and psychological health and well-being required for safely working in emergency response career fields.

BFF9F4B6BC1643F98718B2C1FFE7853B.description: Complete certification in emergency care as appropriate—for example, cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), automated external defibrillator (AED), and first aid.

1EBB7EA0589A490EA6D4F36C7887AFE4.description: Demonstrate strategies to identify and eliminate hazards.

DA658C7CFDB6449294D2117F485A5BEC.description: Understand and adhere to comprehensive and systematic risk management strategies to reduce injury and fatalities for self, team, and community.

F119E99C603540F5AA440F44661F7902.description: Know how to establish situational awareness, identify hazards, and assess personal, team, or environmental risks.

8C8F86C5C4214536B3E365344863A02A.description: Know and use the appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) required for emergency services duties.

C744375160744F9FA4F5C4BF378B3D8F.description: Describe the basic elements of safety and survival for emergency response personnel.

4C6AA965883E4FC19011EFA6E45DCCD1.description: Execute safety procedures and protocols associated with local, state, and federal regulations in order to effectively and safely conduct duties within fire and emergency services.

24D0D2CFD63944F5A18197809961CB43.description: Gather information and ideas from primary and secondary sources accurately and coherently.

6C6B65C165BD4AEB8714FF49ADF40152.description: Practice verbal and nonverbal emergency terminology and communication techniques to be used when interacting with emergency response personnel in a variety of emergency situations.

E697260090D2405FA4839CC06EF65800.description: Use and maintain a variety of communication equipment, understanding the importance of using current and up-to-date technology and communication equipment.

49CE7E8CDCDB4677B710B0C85D99B208.description: Use appropriate terminology in clear, concise, and legible report entries when preparing and submitting required reports.

545EC7DBAA5A4906B9AC85C43025B600.description: Adhere to Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) regulations and agency guidelines regarding public and media communications.

F0BADB54FC724C348D7FC5E992528826.description: Demonstrate a variety of appropriate and effective methods of communicating with the public, including techniques such as professional demeanor, active listening, empathy, projecting a confident tone of voice, paraphrasing, and the proper use of nonverbal body language.

AAE9ABCE983441119C5C411C642BF5BC.description: Describe emergency response techniques and methods of active listening to obtain and clarify information in oral communications.

DEEA29A7B8944F53809058B5707F5F98.description: Employ active listening, concise reporting, and familiarity with emergency response communication equipment to interact efficiently and effectively.

38E78B55DD3248E9B3A5CEFF0D655704.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in community and workplace settings.

E10F7B2209164C9FB466223B7B8F0400.description: Identify the characteristics of successful teams, including leadership, cooperation, collaboration, and effective decision-making skills as applied in emergency services.

339000393FE14D0AAC9939E8BFF27627.description: Demonstrate necessary leadership qualities, team concepts, and personal integrity for emergency response personnel.

B42EB36BF42248A8808308AF2FAAE123.description: Design an emergency plan for an earthquake in a major metropolitan area that has shut off access from all directions.

438A96AABFA04CFEA4F853A4315B9679.description: Review a simulated local hazard mitigation plan based on a potential hazard to the community, and describe the appropriate response.

2187C21AE06F44478A77E485FB52FDFF.description: Describe the principles and responsibilities of the Incident Command System (ICS) and the National Incident Management System (NIMS).

F3D3CA454FB745CE970A1DFD15A56D9A.description: Recognize multiagency coordination; unified command, training, identification and management of resources; qualification and certification; and the collection, tracking, evaluation, and dissemination of information.

3F1186DD50F84138AB3C8C352F793C58.description: Understand the core set of basic concepts, principles, terminology, and technologies of emergency response management.

385C94EA7BD74C5CBE3CA3FC4D93E4B7.description: Understand the importance of an organized Command and Control System to provide for interoperability, efficiency, and effectiveness.

432CC9E1E2AD4253A1AF3D62DFBF30DD.description: Describe the mechanisms by which emergency management stakeholder agencies and resources are coordinated for mutual aid.

AD6B4367DA7E461F9EACB27EFE8A907C.description: Understand the processes by which emergency management organizations and emergency managers exert command and control over an emergency response and recovery operation.

5B076B571A3E4288A738473C7B5D2294.description: Summarize the laws, regulations, and organizational protocols that define the guidelines governing selected emergency agencies and services.

DE0090AA41704CF4A816710799F5EDED.description: Describe the roles and responsibilities of emergency response agencies.

D12AA6A984444F1B9AA118100258130B.description: Outline a realistic program of study (education plan) based on career choice, job-entry requirements, and personal commitment.

9B08792922E84A9C9F73F8902CB2F33F.description: List the standards for emergency response employee qualifications, training, and certification.

CA966049DB8744459CBEBB8913849F10.description: Understand the responsibilities, requirements, and advancement opportunities in emergency response careers.

DB47D0DB6D0D4E3A96EE2EFA7A7F814F.description: Analyze the characteristics of different career fields within the Emergency Response pathway to develop a perspective on the nature of the work, entry-level requirements, career options, and expectations.

comments: The Emergency Response pathway encompasses standards for designing student coursework in preparation for a number of careers in this field. The standards provide the foundation for further professional education and training at a postsecondary level, leading to certification and employment. By mastering these standards, students gain critical knowledge and skills through classroom and job-site experiences, simulations, and other learning modalities. Careers in this pathway include those in fire services, emergency medical services, wildland services, and emergency management.

69487AC8622F4CC69B8A84010758A051.description: Understand the potential impact of assignments to "hardship posts" and dangerous posts on life and family choices.

E15CEC1A07F240EDA29A5482E0979B58.description: Describe the countries and settings in which Foreign Service Officers serve.

17FCB6B8C0BA4DB7AF944C215023AFED.description: Research the history of the Foreign Service and describe how its careers have evolved and how the Foreign Service has impacted the United States and other societies.

B08108C65488434A8827F5F3D8DB9664.description: Describe the roles and responsibilities of different career tracks within the Foreign Service: Consular Officers, Economic Officers, Management Officers, Political Officers, and Public Diplomacy Officers.

C5BA7B77D378492CBB3D9D7D46D31C42.description: Describe the primary mission and role of the Foreign Service.

D3DF2E9E283947519CECFE87E18D91A2.description: Describe the primary mission of the U.S. Department of State and the role of the Foreign Service within that Department.

A6BD77DA8BBF43D795C399AEF8671104.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the functions of the U.S. Foreign Service.

73E4418A08294FF0855F4DBD5B56B123.description: Analyze the various elements of emergency preparedness, including emergency response and recovery, within the context of homeland security.

4B89F87942754FD0A10ABC59858EEBDE.description: Survey the roles, functions, and interdependency among local, federal, and international law enforcement, intelligence, and military agencies.

7181FFE57C2D421087408C4D9DE5E297.description: Understand the role of cyber-security professionals within the homeland defense community and the methods and techniques used to combat public and private cyber attacks.

AD518770F4E149D39826C8D0632848CF.description: List the various techniques and methods of infrastructure and facilities protection.

C44647A443504B8AADCE472773B811F1.description: Identify the current global and national issues and policies concerning terrorism and homeland security.

842E7EEC643B49D09431DE05ACA6B889.description: Recognize the impact of the September 11, 2001, terror attacks on the security and intelligence community structure and the resulting emphasis placed on coordination and cooperation between public safety agencies.

FAD65F8BB6054B9C9FF11CA7ED6D9AEF.description: Assess the local, state, national, and global perspectives on homeland security and the implications of protecting the public from natural and man-made threats to public safety.

F8878925F3824384927B26DBD7E29FAD.description: Describe the mission, roles, and responsibilities of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.

0D01F94107144CEEA214674ED4757E40.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the functions and career opportunities within the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS).

5807BC6D7C5246E3BDBD515F6F1CE67F.description: Understand the role and structure of federal agencies and national organizations.

FE2374B4F56C4EB58D34E8CE4990C3DD.description: Describe the need for, and the responsibilities of, the following functions within the DOD: armored security, maritime security and welfare, air superiority, space operations, and cyber security.

B3D07A4BB9DB4BBA9BF02C2C8089FBB1.description: Understand and adhere to the following personal attributes within the DOD: leadership, teamwork, fitness, honor, integrity, respect, selfless service, and personal courage.

EBE63C21B57C498BAFB65456B812C3AE.description: Describe the structure and composition of the DOD.

7EA4B92BF94C4C5D8CFEC001F82CEFC8.description: Understand the initial entry assessments of physical, educational, and legal for military recruitment and levels of service.

0AC8FFB404FC4CE0896B559CA6AEF200.description: Understand the chain of command within organizations of the DOD.

4BB45923BDD94EC3A3BA5711F86ADA24.description: Describe the mission and role of the DOD and the individual armed services.

72F84294F0C04EA08402F8FE8213462E.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the major elements and career opportunities within the United States Department of Defense (DOD), including the Army, Navy, Marine Corps, Air Force, and Coast Guard.

3AE073E3FC3F495A9992C234ED763146.description: Apply appropriate problem-solving strategies and critical-thinking skills to work-related issues and tasks.

0D3491A39DC64DB69B8145D3E77318FD.description: Explain the management of crisis negotiations to promote the safety of individuals and the public.

D6037B440BFA47688EBC2BCAFB07740F.description: Implement procedures for emergency response and know the requirements for handling hazardous materials—in normal and emergency situations—to avoid health and environmental risks (e.g., airborne and blood-borne pathogens, contamination).

05C37F66BA5B4D7283C42A06FE0355CC.description: Practice basic emergency lifesaving techniques in order to apply those skills as needed in emergencies.

9BC9907A4A6F4EE0A63E25BBC14CBEF6.description: Demonstrate the techniques for restraining individuals without violating their individual rights or jeopardizing safety.

4A179A3F9ABF4EB9A725BF0580257B4B.description: Understand the safety and health issues related to serving persons with disabilities.

1A849890A48F49B9B93EA8A2264E6E58.description: List the key elements of an action plan.

EB63277BF4CF4EC48824DA3477856672.description: Become familiar with personal safety procedures to meet prescribed regulations and situations.

EAC5DDF310A14AF59868D163B643F0A4.description: Identify the skills required to deal effectively with emergency situations.

E7FBDA2951E3417B9186377394B6876F.description: Know the principles of emergency communications management and the importance of technological interoperability for information sharing among public safety agencies and for effective public address/warning systems.

5FFED63BB18F4EC1A42EC3138A47246A.description: Know the skills and equipment needed to deal with various types of situations found in public safety occupations (e.g., working with special populations, responding to emergencies, and assisting with incidents).

455F284997BF4A37A703B005D4D386EB.description: Prepare a chart showing the organizational chain of command and other administrative systems to assign tasks and responsibilities for maximum effectiveness.

209B98D808CD4613B2FA0C3909089B26.description: Explain the importance of individual liberties and civil rights provided in the Constitution and how public safety workers should safeguard these rights when interacting with the public.

781B7808586A46C19D5C45559A23B9CD.description: Describe how federal, state, and local laws and regulations affect public safety operations

2162DA5EF2FB42FBBBD4A164EDCE3B58.description: Understand the laws, ordinances, regulations, and organizational policies that guide public safety career fields.

8180AB9CA17147E6A3E7966F59D28B4E.description: Convey information and ideas from primary and secondary sources accurately and coherently, consistent with agency report-writing formats.

D0BF880B1BCB4FDB8F28C8F4A408A93F.description: Narrate a sequence of events consistent with agency reporting formats.

44E98D5014F74F65BD32248A1EC2F203.description: Practice public safety verbal communication techniques that can be used when interacting with difficult individuals.

6282713929684F839E5817574BF1FD0E.description: Understand the professional use of a variety of communication methods and equipment.

796ECCBDF4B9487884F0E4D44BA1D8FD.description: Demonstrate the use of clear, concise, and legible entries based on experience and observation to prepare and submit required reports.

F499D0514A4C4CA5B0CF92DC72514723.description: Demonstrate effective methods of communicating with the public with a variety of techniques, such as command presence, active listening, and empathy; projecting a professional tone of voice; paraphrasing; and the proper use of nonverbal body language.

6EFA6764A3E2424DB179D5B80BFE2C1B.description: Know the basic techniques and methods of active listening to obtain and clarify information in oral communications.

EAFCCEC3462D4740A103200F02A306DD.description: Employ active listening, concise reporting, and familiarity with professional equipment to communicate effectively.

22D0651B0E3F4D2B8E9D7867BA35F9F6.description: Design and implement a personal plan for achieving and maintaining an acceptable level of agility and a lifetime fitness mindset.

3F29E1D8E2DE4BEBB497EE7B60AC8941.description: Recognize the different physical agility assessments required for entrance into a public safety career and understand the skills and techniques necessary for success in agility testing.

76E6EBD0027F487EB7EE68090B50FAA2.description: Understand the need for physical fitness and proper nutrition in the public safety career areas.

AA1E9037DFA04FADBD5C634100C5EED1.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the appropriate level of nutrition, fitness, and agility required by the public safety career fields.

9D5F73E95BF245DE928864B8EE27A8AE.description: Create a scenario that includes a potential threat from terrorism, a hostage situation, or danger at a school site, describing who should respond and actions that should be taken.

F81557EB970941D1A5DD2EC7D2419832.description: Analyze and evaluate ideas, proposals, and solutions to problems.

DC1FA45876D34E2DA0E77DCD36925002.description: Survey the history of public safety agencies in the United States and their influence on the current systems.

CC7BDFC0237B4C22B763D14774D86EF2.description: Apply critical-thinking skills to manage emergency response situations.

0B7091A5CB5E4DC29488F76934273802.description: Use conflict-resolution and anger-management skills and procedures to resolve problems.

E5869ECB3237423991AFFDD7751CE461.description: Analyze information to make prompt, effective, and appropriate decisions.

4BE8CD484C434559A01B2C5FC1343F90.description: Identify the major public safety agencies at the international, national, state, and local levels, as well as scenarios (including response to catastrophic events with multiple casualties) that call for a referral to a higher-level agency or collaboration with other public safety agencies.

1DF63EC547E340EA9F68E46A9589FE42.description: Describe public safety agency roles in preventing terrorism, enhancing security, managing border security, securing cyberspace, and preparing for and responding to emergencies and disasters.

E3D9FAC5F8BF4A95A00500C451D511F9.description: Describe the public safety agency role in saving lives, protecting lives and property, reducing the vulnerability of critical infrastructure, identifying key resources, and maintaining order.

C9CCFE6BFE0D4B0290B4A2F198824E86.description: Recognize issues particular to policing and other public safety occupations, including accountability, codes of ethical conduct, jurisdiction, and civil rights of individuals.

3500E10C121F4C30BD869F5B3680E2DD.description: Describe the history, shared mission, and roles of public safety agencies and professionals at the national, state, and local government levels.

9A60F38B060A4CE28CAD04F46BDE32AF.description: Compile a personal portfolio specific to the expectations for employment in a public safety career.

15FFF37FF3994EC1A8137353562DBA68.description: Understand how to interact with others in ways that demonstrate respect for persons, property, individual lifestyle choices, and cultural differences.

843263312B2D4951B7630691847BBCFA.description: Understand how loyalty, duty, honor, integrity, selfless service, and personal courage play an important role in many public safety occupations.

F686BB80CA6E4554B4FB11D468B8D57A.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in the school, community, and workplace settings.

F2B217EE2513425BAAE08510083E72DF.description: Understand the importance of security and background checks, credit checks, and other assessments—including oral interviews and polygraph tests—that are required for some public safety occupations.

D4E846B523884D34899A43D08FCF7C5C.description: Understand the selection process for many public safety occupations that require certifications, reading and writing assessments, psychological evaluations, medical evaluations, and probationary periods.

4290CEB423324DCBA70FA9490C675154.description: Understand the necessity of maintaining strong academic records, high levels of physical fitness, and positive personal history to successfully pursue a career in a public safety.

934E319955C644B7B7B99E8A24ACD34C.description: Demonstrate strategies and requirements for individuals and organizations to employ to respond to unethical and illegal actions in a variety of workplace situations.

321E979DE3994B088CE500C8564613C9.description: Know personal and ethical behaviors that demonstrate commitment to professional ethics and legal responsibilities.

3F271A7A86314830ACF1CEAD48E8F36A.description: Recognize the extent and scope of a background investigation, what sorts of information is collected, and how it may impact the evaluation of a candidate for a position in a public safety occupation.

F8411459F65441EF9A0CD280B7886646.description: Identify a range of personal choices and conduct that would disqualify an individual from public safety occupations, and describe ways to avoid such behaviors.

8F388CDA979A436CADDC84F5C2A82D0F.description: State the major types of occupations found in the Public Safety Pathway and the number of those occupations that require background-investigation security clearance and personal records free of disqualifying information.

BBC388BA533A46E29F53666A481048B8.description: Demonstrate an awareness of the personal, physical, and psychological qualities found in successful public safety job candidates, and recall critical types of decisions and outcomes which determine employability in public safety occupations.

comments: The Public Safety pathway prepares students with a broad-based foundational knowledge in careers that involve public safety. The educational foundation will assist students who wish to pursue related professional training at the postsecondary level. Students will gain experience through classroom instruction, hands-on training, and community exercises. The evolving integration of state public safety organizations, their connections with federal and state intelligence and security agencies, interoperability and coordination of effort, and the shared mission to protect the public in a post-9/11 world are areas of emphasis for the pathway. The careers included in this pathway primarily address law enforcement services, homeland and cyber security services, and correctional services.

D40F2DD2BFB2477C9CB1CEE69F31EBCA.description: Create a portfolio, or similar collection of work, that offers evidence through assessment and evaluation of skills and knowledge competency as contained in the anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators.

A887E6AEEFAE4D84979FFC8B2F2CA3E8.description: Employ entrepreneurial practices and behaviors appropriate to Public Services sector opportunities.

A478CFB8209B460BB7CE258AF2CADEE4.description: Demonstrate entrepreneurship skills and knowledge of self-employment options and innovative ventures.

56826E88A9814C3F93E8A5275CEEB148.description: Demonstrate proficiency in a career technical pathway that leads to certification, licensure, and/or continued learning at the postsecondary level.

E2E1623078914747AE8ABE2B523A9D03.description: Utilize work-based/workplace learning experiences to demonstrate and expand upon knowledge and skills gained during classroom instruction and laboratory practices specific to the Public Services sector program of study.

comments: Demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills contained in the Public Services anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators in classroom, laboratory and workplace settings, and through the Cal-HOSA and SkillsUSA career technical student organizations.

E67D9E3A52084D2D9716F42AD977FDEF.description: Collaborate with industry experts for specific technical knowledge and skills.

BA8E6CD6236C45F793A5E994A0AC67C3.description: Construct projects and products specific to the Public Services sector requirements and expectations.

D9A08F5126CA4624AEB09F6F02E7A676.description: Comply with the rules, regulations, and expectations of all aspects of the Public Services sector.

E921EA60738C4495928C86EF7AE89F39.description: Interpret and explain terminology and practices specific to the Public Services sector.

comments: Apply essential technical knowledge and skills common to all pathways in the Public Services sector, following procedures when carrying out experiments or performing technical tasks.

7AA75F7DB994458FBA00E18144ED3C34.description: Participate in interactive teamwork to solve real Public Services sector issues and problems.

2C0D7F21B7934F6480C8F4118EC092E2.description: Respect individual and cultural differences and recognize the importance of diversity in the workplace.

B637D64683F34F2BBA878790F02D1AF0.description: Understand that the modern world is an international community and requires an expanded global view.

264119DEAC9B4A8181DF4983E1609373.description: Explain how professional associations and organizations and associated leadership development and competitive career development activities enhance academic preparation, promote career choices, and contribute to employment opportunities.

7A94D51CC89C4729B66A3FEAFFF87645.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in the school, community, and workplace setting.

9F49ECF1DB214E94BE1ED055A269CAB4.description: Identify the characteristics of successful teams, including leadership, cooperation, collaboration, and effective decision-making skills as applied in groups, teams, and career technical student organization activities.

F20D0B3762764341BCDB521CB3A81AB3.description: Define leadership and identify the responsibilities, competencies, and behaviors of successful leaders.

comments: Work with peers to promote divergent and creative perspectives, effective leadership, group dynamics, team and individual decision making, benefits of workforce diversity, and conflict resolution as practiced in the Cal-HOSA and SkillsUSA career technical student organizations.

14EEBEC350DA4921A48D20263A1381BC.description: Conform to rules and regulations regarding sharing of confidential information, as determined by Public Services sector laws and practices.

C43C57B301E940CB9AEC5139951A6981.description: Adhere to copyright and intellectual property laws and regulations, and use and appropriately cite proprietary information.

8ADFC88D781B43079D7C0F8EF1696A3D.description: Analyze organizational culture and practices within the workplace environment.

F5143690AACC4BA4B05D69EE023478DB.description: Explain the importance of personal integrity, confidentiality, and ethical behavior in the workplace.

0E27994DC4E24225ADB94CE71FC51824.description: Demonstrate ethical and legal practices consistent with Public Services sector workplace standards.

8C9061C082554E9FBBE5768199896386.description: Identify local, district, state, and federal regulatory agencies, entities, laws, and regulations related to the Public Services industry sector.

CB18D8F3661743B5BF36E8341E0861E1.description: Access, analyze, and implement quality assurance standards of practice.

comments: Practice professional, ethical, and legal behavior, responding thoughtfully to diverse perspectives and resolving contradictions when possible, consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and organizational norms.

42AFCCA78DD741879A1DF55CF18A2FB0.description: Explore issues of global significance and document the impact on the Public Services sector.

DD15B8239D244DAEAEBD50FB69B99343.description: Demonstrate the qualities and behaviors that constitute a positive and professional work demeanor, including appropriate attire for the profession.

923EA12E1B524A7FA97E1674F52801D2.description: Demonstrate knowledge and practice of responsible financial management.

022AE8BEE66E42CDBB2FB389A45D998D.description: Apply high-quality techniques to product or presentation design and development.

C21DB9764161497F96C4F48402D79EE2.description: Practice time management and efficiency to fulfill responsibilities.

4180BA631305404589269EC291BE1F8D.description: Understand the need to adapt to changing and varied roles and responsibilities.

1AF51A25AD6040769EF30D38677C0074.description: Explain the importance of accountability and responsibility in fulfilling personal, community, and workplace roles.

80FCEE3A1A2E45E38B2CB1FB87270850.description: Recognize how financial management impacts the economy, workforce, and community.

comments: Initiate, and participate in, a range of collaborations demonstrating behaviors that reflect personal and professional responsibility, flexibility, and respect in the Public Services sector workplace environment and community settings.

7C46E0ABD211499382DC5AA10D392ED5.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

674E73802BD2472E9D5081E3943E83E5.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

CDCF50C45B724A4988585F5F59AE6E0B.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

F39387213D1D467BA0CCDE97671160A7.description: Locate, and adhere to, Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) instructions.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Public Services sector workplace environment.

2375BC6C1F1947CAB52A11B586649231.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

65865A6AD1E24A05978E407CEF8951D2.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

A29B6740F1F747598E0BD02DC19BB7F6.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short, as well as more sustained, research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Public Services sector using critical and creative thinking, logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

35660EE58CFC45178F08E1083BDC9CEC.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

67DE31843D434491B4FFF7CC8381E11E.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

2C6CC85CEE684637A78FAED62A8529A3.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

4E07EA98AAC140859244A78E5256CD50.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

433098D06A3340708256C02E33D029A7.description: Employ Web-based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

28AF1B2B32B94384A5DDECCDAADDFD53.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

7381109629A0495380077D0C14EC88A1.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

4A630FF579B340BB8368208BFED4D205.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

CF778E126D034C2BBB2F196D24DCEF50.description: Recognize the importance of small business in the California and global economies.

1ED93A36EEBD4CC1BC5581669CB777EA.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

76CDF80B8032449A8FE10B35266A04E8.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

C053AC110B674BF49FAB1D9BAFEF2871.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

5170E453318D475EAC912D9D212739F3.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

D9EEDEE617AA4A379254DAFD4A05C930.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

1A0E01D08ADD44F69A09A6FED77B1EE9.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

849034D3E3C84CDAB45C56694117E997.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

F5C7C821C6814B008C30414432A3FE08.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

E07BDCF4810644DEA0FCEAE4E527824C.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

9231EAD62A4642F7A6D91185BDD32456.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

FC41D05EF85B472EBA3BA20C8C0F6366.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

34151880ED6C49D0BC695EAE4CE92FBF.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a sender–receiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Public Services sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Public Services academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
